current_ai_discussions.section: Proposal for discussion: No-AI Certification in Unblock Requests
current_ai_discussions.comment_preview:
(UTC)
:agree with language, but enforcing any AI detection with tools like gptzero would be a hard no for me while they have false positive rates.
:at most, an admin should ask for more clarification if they believe there isn't sincerity in changing behavior.

(UTC)
:Support interlinking/inclusion, the two are complementary and drive towards the same goal. A guideline might be a continuous work in progress, but as a very basic point is that we should expect that all enhanced images include such information in their description, as we would expect for exam...

(UTC)
:::I would say that's correct, I've been seeing some spammers use [[Large language model|LLMs]] to generate plausible text to hide [[WP:REFSPAM]] within. The "instructions" above will be reflective of what was requested in the initial prompt. [[Special:Contributions/fifteen thousand two hundre...

Following [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(policy)/Archive_201#URLs_with_utm_source=chatgpt.com_codes]], I have added detection for possible AI-generated slop to my script.

Possible [[WP:UPSD#AI-generated|AI-slop]] sources will be flagged in {{highlight|orange|orange;}}, thought I'm open to changing that ...
